Articles.Content:
After spending about 4 hours looking for a thread covering this, I've decided to make my own.

With all the mods out there that add their own parts to the tech tree and the many variations that exists with the TreeLoader mod. I want to make sure that all the parts are where they should be when I play Career mode. And since you cannot view the research at all when in Sandbox mode, I need some other way to make sure of that.

So I'm looking for a way to unlock all research through some mod or cheat. So that I can verify that I won't be missing out on any mods without spending several days getting the science to unlock everything then finding out I need to start over and pick another tech tree. Is there some way to do this or am I all out of luck?

This topic may be in the wrong subforum, and I apologize if that's the case. But I do thank you for any and all answers I might get.

One option might be to make a new game then modify the persistent.sfs (opened with most writing programs as a txt file) so that you have 1,000,000 science or something like that. I know this is not a perfect solution but it is quick.

Go into your save file's persistent.sfs file and look for this section:

SCENARIO

{

name = ResearchAndDevelopment

scene = 5, 6, 7, 8, 9

sci = 5

Change the number after "sci =" to about 12000 and next time you load that save, you can spend that much to unlock nodes.
Exactly what I needed! Thank you very much for the help. Now I can finally decide which tech tree to use so I can use everything. Woo!
